primary_person.name: Ghislaine Noelle Maxwell
primary_person.summary: British socialite, youngest child of publisher Robert Maxwell. Long-time associate and alleged co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein. Founded TerraMar Project (ocean conservation non-profit). Licensed helicopter pilot, certified EMT, submersible pilot.

family_members.name: Elisabeth Maxwell
family_members.note: Reportedly became ill June 2010 when Ghislaine used as excuse to avoid deposition

associates.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
associates.relationship_context: Met in NYC in 1992 after father's death. Allegedly intimately involved in all of Epstein's crimes. Helped scout and procure girls since mid-1990s.

associates.name: Bill Clinton
associates.relationship_context: Allegedly introduced Epstein to Clinton. Friends with Clinton's assistant Doug Bands.

associates.name: Virginia Roberts Giuffre
associates.relationship_context: Sued Maxwell for defamation after Maxwell called accusations 'all lies'

associates.name: Brett Jaffe
associates.relationship_context: Represented Maxwell in 2009, from firm Cohen and Gresser

associates.name: Chelsea Clinton
associates.relationship_context: Maxwell attended Chelsea Clinton's wedding July 31, 2010 in Rhinebeck NY, photographed by OK magazine

organizations.name: The TerraMar Project
organizations.description: Web-based non-profit to protect ocean commons, empower global community of ocean citizens. Collaborated with stakeholders on 2015 UN Sustainable Development Goals. Published 'The Daily Catch' online newspaper.

organizations.name: Clinton Global Initiative
organizations.relationship: pledged support in 2013 via TerraMar Project

organizations.name: United Nations
organizations.relationship: TerraMar Project collaborated on 2015 Sustainable Development Goals

locations.name: New York City
locations.relationship: moved here 1992 after father's death, where she met Epstein

locations.name: Rhinebeck
locations.description: Location of Chelsea Clinton's wedding July 31, 2010

legal_cases.description: Ghislaine first served for deposition, failed to appear
Rescheduled deposition. Day before, lawyer said Maxwell flying to England for ill mother, no intention of returning to US

legal_cases.case_name: Virginia L Giuffre vs. Ghislaine Maxwell
legal_cases.description: Defamation lawsuit filed by Virginia Roberts Giuffre after Maxwell called accusations 'all lies'. Suit still ongoing as of document date.

events.name: Born
events.description: Born Ghislaine Noelle Maxwell, youngest child of Robert and Elisabeth Maxwell

events.name: Graduated Oxford
events.description: Graduated Oxford University with B.A. – M.A.

events.name: Father's death
events.description: Father Robert Maxwell died, rumored she was destitute afterwards

events.name: Moved to NYC, met Epstein
events.description: Moved to New York City where she met Jeffrey Epstein

events.name: Began procuring for Epstein
events.description: Had been helping Epstein scout and procure girls since mid-nineties

events.name: Failed to appear for deposition
events.description: First served for deposition, failed to appear

events.name: Avoided deposition, fled to England
events.description: Day before rescheduled deposition, lawyer said flying to England for ill mother, no intention to return to US

events.name: Attended Chelsea Clinton wedding
events.description: Photographed by OK magazine at Chelsea Clinton's wedding in Rhinebeck NY (one month after claiming no intention to return to US)

events.name: Pledged Clinton Global Initiative support
events.description: Pledged to support Clinton Global Initiative with TerraMar Project

events.name: Made public statement
events.description: Made public statement calling accusations against her 'all lies'

events.name: Sued for defamation
events.description: Virginia Roberts Giuffre sued her for defamation

notes: Profile emphasizes Maxwell's avoidance of legal proceedings and continued social connections despite accusations
TerraMar Project timing (2012 founding, Clinton Initiative 2013) notable given ongoing legal issues
Wedding attendance (July 2010) one month after claiming permanent departure from US shows continued US presence
